item.description:
We hike at Northwest Park a lot, so for those who are able, let's lend them a hand with some spring cleaning. Volunteers will help with litter cleanup, trail repair, butterfly and organic garden work, and planting shrubs as part of Earth Day Action Week.

Northwest Park provides all of the tools and supplies. Volunteers are asked to bring their own work gloves.

Start time is 9:00, so we're asking our group to meet at 8:45 at our usual place in the parking lot and then we can report as a group to the nature center at 9:00.

We will be doing some pond clean-up, but they have assured me that we will not get our feet wet, and also planting trees.  It is estimated that our project will take 2 to 2 1/2 hours.

No special equipment needed, but dress for the weather and you may want work gloves.

The park will provide snacks and beverages.

Participants are invited to an Earth Day concert at 2:00 and free passes will be handed out to those who volunteer.  If you want to stay for the concert, you can feel free to pack a lunch or go home for lunch and clean-up and then come back to the concert.  If we have the group we expect and are done before noon, I'd be open to a little picnic and a short hike before the concert.


I'll need to register us for this event, so I'm cutting off registration a couple of days before and please, if you sign up, show up, as we'll be counting on you to help.
item.how_to_find_us: Meet in the parking lot at 8:45 so we can report as a group at 9:00

group.name: The Hartford Area Hiking™ Meetup Group

item.name: Work Day at Northwest Park
